definition: contrary/opposite/backwards/to go against/to oppose/to betray/to rebel

sentences.english: The legacy of their disobedience is passed down to every generation.
sentences.chinese: 他們的忤逆一代代傳承下來。

sentences.english: But this people hath a revolting and a rebellious heart; they are revolted and gone.
sentences.chinese: 但這百姓有背叛忤逆的心。

sentences.english: Many servants are breaking away from their masters these days.
sentences.chinese: 近來忤逆主人奔逃的僕人甚多。

sentences.english: When they grow up they will rebel and become unfilial children.
sentences.chinese: 長大後，自然動輒忤逆反抗，成爲一個不孝子。

sentences.english: Her kids never obey her orders.
sentences.chinese: 她的幾個孩子從不忤逆她。

sentences.english: Man's disobedience is the cause of the human predicament.
sentences.chinese: 人類的忤逆是其所處困境的原因。

sentences.english: But all such is disobedience and rebellion.
sentences.chinese: 但此類行爲統統都屬忤逆不肖。

sentences.english: Civil disobedience is by definition a violation of the law .
sentences.chinese: 民用忤逆是由定義侵害法律。

sentences.english: He viewed his son's lawless behavior as an attack on himself.
sentences.chinese: 他把兒子的不法行爲看作是對自己的忤逆。

definition: to disobey/to defy an edict/to violate/to go against/to run counter to
disgraceful (of behavior that is unfilial, rebellious or otherwise in grave breach of the norms of society)
to disobey/to defy/deliberately going against (rule, convention, sb's wishes etc)
to disrespect one's superiors/to offend one's elders
against orders/to disobey/to refuse to accept orders
to forgive easily/to let off lightly (often with negative: you won't get away with it)
